headline.main: INTERESTING FROM THE REBEL ARMY.; Statements of a Deserter on the Line of the Lower Potomac. Number, Condition and Prospects of the Rebel Troops.

docs.lead_paragraph: The camp of the Eleventh Massachusetts Regiment was thrown into a state of mingled curiosity and excitement this morning by the arrival of a seeesh deserter, who excaped from the rebel batteries at Evansport, on the opposite side of the river, and crossed over to our pickets.

docs.lead_paragraph: The "Vesper service," introduced into the Unitarian Church, by Rev. SAMUEL LONGFELLOW, in 1858, while pastor of the Second Unitarian Church of Brooklyn, seems destined to win wide favor. It was some time since adopted by several of the leading churches of that faith in New-England, and has recently been introduced into Rev. Dr. OSGOOD'S Church,...

headline.main: GENERAL CITY NEWS.; Fair for the Benefit of Volunteers' Children. Arrivals in the City.
FROM BERMUDA.; Arrival of the Commander-in-Chief of the English Expedition to Mexico.

headline.main: A MYSTERIOUS TRAGEDY.; A Broker is Found is His own Office With His Throat Cut from Ear to Ear. Coroner's Inquest--Verdict of the Jury --No Clue to the Mystery.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday, about 10 o'clock A.M., an Exchange Broker, named BERNARD LEVY, one of the firm of L. B. LEVY SON, of No. 146 Canal-street, under the Citizens' Bank, was found in his own office with his throat cut in a most horrible manner. Life was extinct when he was discovered, though the body was still warm.
